feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 3:08PM AKST until December 29 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW RETURNS TO HAINES AND THE HIGHWAY... .Light to moderate snow will return to Haines late tonight as a surface low lifts north through the Panhandle. Snow is expected through Thursday night before changing to rain Friday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM THURSDAY TO 3 AM AKST FRIDAY...

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued December 27 at 11:59AM AKST until December 27 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...VERY GUSTY WINDS FOR DOWNTOWN JUNEAU AND DOUGLAS THROUGH THIS EVENING... .Mountain wave conditions have formed and started to gust to 60 mph near sea level. Expect the gusts to increase through the afternoon and evening. ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING...

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 27 at 7:39AM AKST until December 28 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph with visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Shemya.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 5:35AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG FRONT TO BRING SNOW, BLOWING SNOW, AND MIXED PRECIPITATION TO CENTRAL ALEUTIANS TONIGHT... A strong front will move east across the Aleutians today, bringing strong southerly winds, snow, blowing snow and some rain to Adak and Atka. Cold air ahead of the front should lead to snow as the initial precipitation type as the front reaches Adak around 7pm

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued December 27 at 11:01AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT: MANDATORY WOOD-BURNING BAN IN EFFECT... The South Coast AQMD has extended a mandatory wood-burning ban for residents in the South Coast Air Basin for Wed Dec 27 through Thurs Dec 28. No-Burn days are declared to protect public health when levels of fine particle air pollution in the region are forecast to be high.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 8:58PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The St. Johns River at Astor remains in Minor Flood stage while continuing a very slow decline. The river is forecast to drop in to Action Stage early next week, but increasing northerly winds mid next week could cause levels to rise back into Minor Flood

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 9:16PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: .Lookout Shoals Lake along the Catawba River chain is spilling and is currently at 102.4 feet, above the action stage of 102.0 feet. It will continue to slowly fall overnight through Thursday morning. The Catawba River Basin is experiencing increased inflows from recent rainfall. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST THURSDAY...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 8:38PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG POSSIBLE INTO LATE TONIGHT... Patchy dense fog has overspread portions of the Coastal Plain from Lenoir County north to Martin County this evening with visibilities as low as 1 to 2 miles. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 6:14PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: Gusty winds have returned to the environment from the lingering pressure gradient of a passing trough, affecting the foothills of the Blue Mountains, particularly Cabbage Hill. Expecting these winds to persist just a little longer, but conditions should be deteriorating and weakening the environment for sustained strong wind gusts over the next few hours.
